channel.title: Thunder & Lightning
channel.description: Brian Hadad of SportsTalk Mississippi and Robbie Faulk of 24/7 give you the best insight into Mississippi State athletics. Covering the Bulldogs like no one else. This show is a production of SuperTalk Mississippi Media. Learn more at SuperTalk.FM
channel.itunes:author: SuperTalk Mississippi

item.title: 8-20-21: What Questions Remain Unanswered Through Mississippi State's Preseason Camp?
item.description: Mississippi State is about halfway through its preseason camp, and there are still some big questions to answer about the Bulldogs. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk try to find some answers prior to Saturday's scrimmage in Davis Wade Stadium.

item.title: 8-19-21: Mississippi State Faces a Dangerous Opponent in North Carolina State
item.description: When you look at North Carolina State on paper, you see a team that returns a lot of production and experience. How does Mississippi State match up with their Week 2 opponent? Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk take a look at the Wolfpack, with help from Jonas Pope IV of the Raleigh News & Observer.

item.title: 8-16-21: Thoughts From Mississippi State's First Scrimmage
item.description: Mississippi State hit the field at Davis Wade Stadium on Saturday to scrimmage for the first time in training camp. What did Brian Hadad come away thinking about the Bulldogs? He reveals all that plus takes a a look at an addition and departure to the 2022 signing class for football.

item.title: 8-13-21: Mississippi State's Trip to Memphis Is the Trap Game of the Season
item.description: A road game against a top Group of Five team sandwiched between home dates with North Carolina State and LSU, played in sweltering heat in front of a rabid crowd? It smells like a trap game to Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk. The guys explain why Mississippi State fans should be concerned, but not worried, about State's trip to Memphis.

item.title: 8-6-21: Mississippi State Opens Training Camp
item.description: Friday afternoon will see footballs in the air, whistles being blown, and the sweet sounds of snap counts on the Mississippi State campus, as the Bulldogs open camp for the 2021 season. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk discuss what they'll be looking to see, what positions they feel confident about, and what newcomers have their attention.

item.title: 8-5-21: Can Mississippi State Keeps its Momentum Against LSU?
item.description: For two decades, LSU was completely dominant in its annual series with Mississippi State, but the Bulldogs have gotten back on level terms with the Tigers, and ran up a record setting day in Baton Rouge a season ago. Can the Bulldogs keep the upper hand on their rivals from the Bayou this season, or will Ed Orgeron's team get revenge in Starkville? Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk break down how this crucial SEC West match up will play out.

item.title: 8-3-21: Mississippi State's Commitment to Baseball Continues to Grow
item.description: Mississippi State announced a sizeable raise for their national championship winning coach Chris Lemonis last week, and now it appears the Diamond Dawgs are giving a commitment to baseball that can be matched by few if any programs. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk discuss the idea that this might be the start of a dominant era in Bulldog baseball.

item.title: 8-1-21: Can Mississippi State Close Summer Recruiting on a High Note?
item.description: Mississippi State's 2022 recruiting class has experienced some ebbs and flows, but the Bulldogs look like they sit about where they normally do in the rankings. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk look at the latest addition to the group, and try to predict who could be next to give their pledge to Coach Mike Leach and his staff.

item.title: 7-27-21: Inside the Numbers for Mississippi State's 2021 Season

item.title: 7-26-21: Mississippi State Gets No Respect From the SEC Media
item.description: Mississippi State was dead last in the SEC West in last week's Media Days predicted order of finish, ahead of only Vanderbilt in the picks. Why is there no love for the Bulldogs in Mike Leach's second year? Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk examine the reasons State isn't getting much preseason respect.

item.title: 7-23-21: Does Mississippi State Benefit in an Expanded SEC?
item.description: It was one of the biggest bombshells in recent memory, and now it appears almost set in stone that Texas and Oklahoma are headed to the SEC. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk discuss what those huge additions would mean for the conference and more importantly, to Mississippi State.

item.title: 7-22-21: What to Make of Mississippi State's Day in Hoover
item.description: Mississippi State took its turn through the media meat grinder that is SEC Media Days, with Coach Mike Leach, linebacker Aaron Brule, and wide receiver Austin Williams all getting their time in the spotlight. item.title: 7-14-21: Can Mississippi State Get a 1000 Yard Receiver Next Season?
item.description: Mississippi State has never been a passing school, that is prior to the arrival of Mike Leach. Now in year two, can Leach's offense put up the kind of numbers at the receiver position that have only been seen twice before in school history? Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk discuss whether or not the Bulldogs can get a receiver over the 1000 yard mark.

item.title: 7-12-21: Mississippi State's First Round Streak Should Continue With Will Bednar
item.description: Sunday should mark the third straight year that Mississippi State baseball has seen one of its roster taken in the first round of the Major League Baseball draft. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk examine all the Diamond Dawgs who could hear their name called over the next three days, and which recruits are worth watching as they decide between college and pro ball.

item.title: 7-9-21: Mississippi State's Season Will Make or Break in November
item.description: Mississippi State's season is always defined in some ways by November, with the Egg Bowl being at season's end. But this year, a three game stretch before the final two weeks will shape the entire 2021 campaign. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk examine the Kentucky, Auburn, and Arkansas games and how everything rides on finding wins late in the year.

item.description: Mississippi State's trip to Lexington a season ago saw the Bulldogs absolutely embarrassed by the home team. Can the Bulldogs get revenge in Starkville this year? Brian Hadad gets the preview of the Wildcats from CatsPause247's Derek Terry.

item.description: Mississippi State-Auburn has been a competitive series over the last decade, and the winner usually finds their way into a good bowl. Brian Hadad talks with Jason Caldwell of Inside the Auburn Tigers to preview this November showdown on the plains.

item.title: T&L Opponent Preview: HawgBeat.com's Andrew Hutchison Previews Arkansas
item.description: Mississippi State's 2020 season started to slide off the rails when Arkansas upset the Bulldogs in Week 2. Can State get revenge this year, or will Sam Pittman's Razorbacks make it two straight? Brian Hadad talks with Andrew Hutchinson of HawgBeat.com for a preview.

item.title: 7-8-21: How Will Mississippi State Close The Summer in Recruiting?
item.description: Mississippi State picked up a big JUCO commitment earlier this week, but the Bulldogs seem to have lost of the momentum on the recruiting trail they had earlier this summer. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk discuss how State can get things going again before fall camp begins, then the guys catch up on three weeks of SEC Previews, hitting South Carolina, Alabama, and Missouri.

item.title: T&L SEC Preview: The State's Ben Portnoy Previews South Carolina
item.description:
South Carolina embarks on a new era with Shane Beamer as the man in charge, but are the Gamecocks built to compete in the SEC East this season. Brian Hadad welcomes his former cohort on the MSU beat, Ben Portnoy of The State, to take a look at what Beamer can do in year one.
Photo courtesy of AP Photo/Sean Rayford

item.title: 7-6-21: Brandon Walker's Omaha Odyssey in Full
item.description:
One of the great storylines on the fan side of Mississippi State's College World Series was run was Brandon Walker taking over the city of Omaha. BFW returns to Starkville to talk with Brian Hadad about that trip, his crazy rise to national prominence, and a few things he wants to get off his chest.**
** Contains some minor adult language

item.title: 7-5-21: A Last Look Back and a First Look Ahead at Mississippi State Baseball
item.description: Mississippi State's national title is home in Starkville, and now the Diamond Dawgs will take their place in history. Brian Hadad welcomes Robbie Faulk back to Starkville, and they discuss how this team got to the top of college baseball, and look at what the Bulldogs will be in 2022 when they attempt to run it back.

item.title: 7-1-21: It Finally Happened For Mississippi State
item.description: Mississippi State has long lived with the label of the best baseball program without a national title. On Wednesday night, the Diamond Dawgs shed that label forever. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk wax poetic about the Bulldogs and their long overdue coronation as the kings of college baseball.

item.title: 6-30-21: Mississippi State Stands One Win Away From a National Title
item.description: Everything went wrong for Mississippi State on Monday night, but the Bulldogs did a complete 180 in their dominating Tuesday night win over Vanderbilt. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk discuss the win and look at how the Diamond Dawgs stack up against Kumar Rocker in the final game of the season.

item.title: 6-29-21: Mississippi State's Season is On The Brink in Omaha
item.description: Mississippi State could not overcome a horrid start, and now stand on the brink of elimination in the College World Series. Can the Bulldogs bounce back in Game 2 against Vanderbilt, or will their storybook season come to an end? Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk discuss what to expect on Tuesday night in Omaha.

item.title: 6-28-21: Mississippi State Heads to the National Championship Series
item.description: Mississippi State continues to find wins in the most dramatic fashion, with Saturday's walk-off victory over Texas being possible the most stressful of all. Now the Bulldogs will head to the finals to take on Vanderbilt for a shot at the national title. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk take a look at this team and ask if they can take that final step.

item.title: 6-25-21: How Does Mississippi State Play Out All the CWS Scenarios?
item.description: Mississippi State is one win away from the national championship series, and there are a ton of scenarios in play for the Bulldogs over the next few days. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk try to work their way through all of them, then look over to Baton Rouge and the hiring of Jay Johnson at LSU. How does that affect the balance of power in the SEC?

item.title: 6-23-21: Mississippi State's Historic Comeback Has Them Poised to Play for a Title
item.description: Mississippi State was all but dead and buried on Tuesday night, but the Bulldogs rose from the grave and now sit one win away from the national championship series. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk relive a wild night at TD Ameritrade Park as the maroon and white find their way home to another crazy comeback win.

item.title: 6-22-21: Mississippi State Gets Ready to Face a Red Hot Virginia Team
item.description: This time of year, nobody wants to take on the team that is playing way above its head. In 2021, that team is the Virginia Cavaliers, and they are up next in Omaha for Mississippi State. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk examine tonight's match up which will see one team be poised to play for a national championship.

item.title: 6-21-21: Electric Pitching Has Mississippi State in the Winner's Bracket
item.description: Pitching has been Mississippi State's strength all season long, but it was never more dominant than on Sunday when it mattered most. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk look back at a historic day on the mound for Will Bednar and Landon Sims, as they power the Bulldogs into a winner's bracket game against Virginia.

It's a battle of two of college baseball's top powers, as Mississippi State and Texas kickoff their College World Series against each other on Sunday night. Brian Hadad welcomes Danny Davis of the Austin American-Statesman to the pod to get an inside look at the Longhorns.
Photo courtesy of the Austin American-Statesman

item.description: Mississippi State baseball is on the road to Omaha, but Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk are still in Starkville diving into another fantastic edition of The Rumblings. There's plenty of baseball and plenty of the rest filling up this week's mailbag.

item.title: 6-16-21: Another Look at Mississippi State's Return to Omaha
item.description: 24 hours after Mississippi State's dramatic series win over Notre Dame, the excitement of a return to Omaha has not tempered for the Bulldog faithful. Now that the immediacy of that game is over, what do we think about the Bulldogs and their chances to grab that elusive national title? Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk take a deeper look at the Diamond Dawgs and what they have working for and against them in the College World Series.

item.title: 6-15-21: Mississippi State Returns to the College World Series
item.description: Mississippi State's season will continue for at least another week, as for the third straight year, the Bulldogs are headed to Omaha and the College World Series. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk look at an incredible Super Regional that saw record crowds watch their Diamond Dawgs do it one more time.

item.title: 6-11-21: Preview, Playmakers and Predictions for Mississippi State-Notre Dame
item.description: Mississippi State and Notre Dame are set to tangle in what might be the most hotly contested Super Regional of the weekend. Can the Bulldogs land a third straight trip to the College World Series, or will the Fighting Irish prove they were snubbed by the committee a week ago? Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk preview what looks like a a tremendous series.

item.description:

item.title: 6-10-21: Looking Way Ahead to the Egg Bowl
item.description: Mississippi State is two days away from playing in a Super Regional and closing in on a third straight College World Series berth. That being said, it just is never too early to talk about the Egg Bowl and the annual clash between the Bulldogs and their bitter rivals from Ole Miss. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk take a look ahead to Thanksgiving Night, with a visit from Ben Garrett of the Ole Miss Spirit to give us an preview of the Rebels.

item.description: Kentucky is the game Mississippi State needs to win every year, but the Wildcats have made the series far more competitive since the departure of Dan Mullen. item.description: For the fifth straight season, Mississippi State baseball has found its way to the Super Regionals. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk discuss that accomplishment and what it means for the program to finally have some consistency after going through four coaches in five seasons.

item.title: 6-7-21: Weather is The Only Thing Between Mississippi State and a Super Regional
item.description: Mississippi State has dominated its first two games in the Starkville Regional, but the rain has the Bulldogs waiting another day to close it out and advance to the next round of postseason play. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk take a look at how the decisions Chris Lemonis has made this weekend have paid off to the point of a fifth straight super regional appearance becoming a reality.

item.title: 6-3-21: How Should Mississippi State Set Up its Regional Rotation?
item.description: Mississippi State's regional will begin Friday, but as of today we still don't know who the Bulldogs will have on the mound to start Game 1. Brian Hadad and Robbie Faulk take a look at the options Chris Lemonis has to choose from, and make their own decisions about how they'd set up the weekend.

item.title: 5-31-21: Mississippi State Appears Set as a National Seed
item.description: After a weekend off and having to watch results around the nation, it appears that even with a forgettable SEC Tournament, Mississippi State is still standing in line for one of the top eight seeds in the NCAA Tournament. item.title: 5-29-21: Joel Rides Off Into the Sunset

item.title: 5-21-21: Thursday Goes Mississippi State's Way Against Alabama
item.description: Mississippi State took game one against Alabama Thursday night in Tuscaloosa behind some dominant pitching, and then watched as several other results went their way across college baseball. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman have the full report as State gets back on track towards a high national seed.

item.description: Mississippi State and Ole Miss meeting on any playing field doesn't need any added pressure, but with the stakes this weekend, there certainly is some to go around. item.title: 4-12-21: Mississippi State Gets Back on Track by Sweeping Auburn
item.description: Two weekends ago, Mississippi State was reeling following a sweep at the hands of Arkansas. Now after back to back sweeps of their own, the Bulldogs are poised to grab control of their national seed destiny with Ole Miss heading to town for Super Bulldog Weekend. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss the three wins in Auburn, plus take a look at Saturday's scrimmage in Davis Wade Stadium and the latest addition to the 2022 signing class.

item.title: T&L Exclusive: Jake Mangum on a Year Without Baseball and His Excitement to Be Back
item.description: It was the longest offseason of Jake Mangum's life, but now the Mississippi State legend is chomping at the bit to return to the diamond. Brian Hadad caught up with the SEC's hit king to discuss a summer without baseball, his goals for this season, and his thoughts on the Diamond Dawgs now that he's watching them like the rest of us.

item.title: 3-25-21: Can Mississippi State's Running Backs be Super Sophomores?
item.description: A season ago, Jo'Quavious Marks and Dillon Johnson were forced into the spotlight after the messy departure of Kylin Hill. A year later, can they take a leap forward and give the Air Raid some ground support? After taking an early look at Mississippi State's huge weekend series with Arkansas, Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss that Bulldog backfield and its 2021 potential.

item.title: 3-16-21: What Has Happened to Mississippi State Women's Basketball?
item.description: Mississippi State's women's basketball had become the crown jewel, as the Bulldogs had firmly established themselves among the top tier of the elite. Now just three years removed from playing for a national title, the Bulldogs are on the outside looking in at the NCAA Tournament. How did it fall so far so fast, and how much blame does Nikki McCray-Penson deserve? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at the surprising collapse of the program.

Now with the Diamond Dawgs have thrown three straight shutouts, is it possible the guys underestimated how good this staff could be? The guys discuss just how high the ceiling is on this elite group of arms.

item.itunes:summary: Mississippi State was a team driven by its freshmen in 2020. What new faces will be the talk of Starkville in 2021? item.description: Coach Zach Arnett's defense was a pleasant surprise in 2020, but he knows his unit has lot of work to do in this offseason. Brian Hadad talks with the Mississippi State defensive coordinator about last season and next, and what he wants from his group.

item.description: The first Wednesday in February used to be one of the most dramatic days of the college football year, but now all that suspense and excitement happens in December. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at the lone signee the Bulldogs added to the 2021 roster, and how they'll work out the final spots for this class.

item.title: 2-2-21: How Much Attrition Will Mississippi State Football Have to Endure?
item.description: Mississippi State saw another player head to the transfer portal, the 18th such departure since Mike Leach took over a year ago. What does that mean for the 2021 roster, and are the Bulldogs done seeing players leave and come in via the portal? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at who might go, and who might the Bulldogs might look to bring in.

item.title: 2-1-21: Can Mississippi State Build On Saturday's Blowout Win?
item.description: Mississippi State had no problems with an outmanned Iowa State squad on Saturday, claiming a blowout win in their SEC-Big XII Challenge appearance. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman wonder how much momentum from that victory can the Bulldogs take into February, where the schedule gets a good deal more difficult.

item.title: 1-22-21: What Players Will Improve in Year Two Under Mike Leach?
item.description: An old saying in college football is you make the biggest improvements as a player between your freshman and sophomore seasons. If that is the case, Mississippi State has a lot of potential for year two under Coach Mike Leach. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at both sides of the ball to see who the Bulldogs can rely on, and who will be questioned all the way until kickoff.

item.title: 1-21-21: Mississippi State Has No Answers Against Ole Miss
item.description: Mississippi State got bullied on its own court by Ole Miss Tuesday night, as the Rebels dominated both ends of the court in a 64-46 win at The Hump. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at another loss, and explain why one fact is the reason why Ben Howland will never enjoy the full support of the Bulldog fanbase.

item.title: 1-15-21: Looking Back at Mike Leach's Year Twos
item.description: Mississippi State is hoping for a lot of improvement in year two of the Mike Leach era, but does history show us that is a fair expectation? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look back at Leach's stops at Texas Tech and Washington State to see how that holds up, then Future Brian joins the show for the first time in 2021 to recap an uninspiring performance by the Bulldog women's basketball team.

item.title: 1-14-21: Mississippi State Gives It Away to Texas A&M
item.description: A week ago, it was Mississippi State that erased a double digit deficit and won in convincing fashion over Missouri. Wednesday night at Humphrey Coliseum, it was the Bulldogs who gave away a big advantage, falling to Texas A&M 56-55. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at another frustrating loss for the maroon and white, then turn their attention to some good news on the gridiron.

item.title: 1-5-21: Making The Case For Erroll Thompson's Return in 2021
item.description: Mississippi State saw so many losses to its roster throughout the 2020 season, but the extra year of eligibility granted by the NCAA has Bulldog fans hoping some players will return for one last ride in maroon and white, chief among them team captain Erroll Thompson. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman try and make a case for Thompson to play one more season for Coach Mike Leach.

item.title: 1-4-21: Mississippi State Basketball Has to Start Back Over
item.itunes:title: 1-4-21: Mississippi State Basketball Has to Start Back Over
item.itunes:subtitle: It seems every season under Ben Howland, Mississippi State basketball reaches a point where a win would re-ignite the fanbase's passion for the team, and every season, the Bulldogs come up short in that game. Saturday saw another such situation, as the Bulldogs dropped a game to Kentucky they should have won, and the maroon and white faithful's grumbling about Howland only grew louder as a result. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at a tough weekend on the court for both sets of Bulldogs.

item.title: 1-1-21: What's True After Mississippi State Bowls and Brawls Over Tulsa?
item.description: Mississippi State finished the season on a high note with its 28-26 win over Tulsa in Thursday's Armed Forces Bowl, then immediately turned the focus from that victory to the huge brawl that broke out after the game. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss the game, the fight, and what is now to come under Mike Leach with his young stars.

item.itunes:title: 12-9-20: Mississippi State Punches Back in Recruiting
item.itunes:summary: Recruiting is very much like a twelve round boxing match, and over the weekend, Mississippi State took some shots. item.itunes:title: T&L Egg Bowl Memories: The 2009 Egg Bowl with Chad Bumphis
item.itunes:summary:
Mississippi State's win in the 2009 Egg Bowl signaled a change in the balance of power in this state, as Dan Mullen so aptly said in his postgame commentary. Brian Hadad welcomes back Chad Bumphis to relive that great victory, as well as some other great moments in the three-game Bulldog winning streak to start Mullen's tenure.

item.title: T&L Exclusive: Former WSU Player John Fullington on Mike Leach and Turning Programs Around
item.description:
In 2012, Mike Leach arrived in Pullman, Washington trying to turn around a program that was at the bottom of the PAC-12. One of his key players was offensive lineman John Fullington, who saw the results of Leach's work in his second season ending in a bowl game. Brian Hadad catches up with the former Cougar to get his thoughts on Leach, the process of becoming an Air Raid team, and why believes Mississippi State has the right man for the job.
Photo courtesy of Mississippi State athletics

item.media:description: Mississippi State's 2020 schedule finally fell victim to the SEC's COVID roster regulations, and Saturday's match up with Auburn will be tacked on to the end of the season. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss the current situation the Bulldogs are facing.

item.description: A win is definitely a win, but it could have been uglier for Mississippi State on Saturday. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss what we know about the Bulldogs after their 24-17 victory over a hapless Vanderbilt team.

item.title: 11-5-20: Mississippi State Faces Do or Die Situation Against Vanderbilt
item.description: Mississippi State's football program is at its lowest point in over a decade, but a match up with Vanderbilt could be just the spark the Bulldogs need to start turning things around. But what it goes the other way? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss the unthinkable, what happens if the Bulldogs fall on Saturday.

item.title: 11-3-20: Where Did It Go Wrong For Mississippi State?
item.description: Mississippi State is a program that has been to ten straight bowls, appearing to be a model of consistency on the outside. Inside, the cracks were hidden but still there, waiting until this season to finally show. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look back through the years to pinpoint how it all got to this point.

item.title: 10-27-20: The Kylin Hill Saga Continues
item.description: Monday's press conference with Mike Leach came and went with no update on Kylin Hill's apparent suspension. Will the Bulldog's star tailback ever see the field again in Starkville or are his days in maroon and white nearing an end? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss that plus the coming decision of who will be at quarterback Saturday in Tuscaloosa.

item.title: T&L Exclusive: Coach Ben Howland Previews the 2020-21 Season
item.description:
When we last saw Ben Howland, he was about to lead his team into the SEC Tournament to fight for a berth in the Big Dance. Now with a completely retooled roster, can the Bulldog head man lead his men back into March Madness? Brian Hadad caught with up with Howland as he prepares to start his sixth season in Starkville.
Photo courtesy of Mississippi State athletics

item.title: T&L Exclusive: ESPN's DJ Shockley Discusses MSU-A&M and KJ Costello
item.description:
Playing quarterback in the SEC has its highs and lows, and nobody knows that better than former Georgia Bulldog and current ESPN color analyst DJ Shockley. Brian Hadad catches up with Shockley to get his thoughts on KJ Costello's start to the season and a preview of Mississippi State-Texas A&M, which Shockley is on the broadcast team for.

item.media:title: T&L Extra: GigEm247's Jeff Tarpley Looks at Texas A&M
item.media:description:
Texas A&M has been an up and down team the first three weeks of the season, but coming off a huge win, a confident group of Aggies is headed to Starkville. Brian Hadad speaks with Jeff Tarpley of GigEm247 to get an inside look at Jimbo Fisher's squad.
Photo courtesy of Mississippi State athletics

item.title: T&L Exclusive: Kayce Smith of Barstool Sports on MSU-A&M and Brandon Walker
item.description:
Mississippi State takes on Texas A&M, and the maroon rivalry will go beyond the field all the way to New York City, as the hosts of Unnecessary Roughness on Barstool Sports will be in Starkville to watch their teams. Kayce Smith, lifelong Aggie, joins Brian Hadad to talk about the game and her upcoming trip to the Golden Triangle with her partner in crime, the infamous Brandon Walker.

Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman take a look at an embarrassing night for the maroon and white.

item.title: 9-28-20: What's True After Mississippi State's Record Setting Win Over LSU?
item.description: Mississippi State's new era got off to a flying start on Saturday, as the Bulldogs tore the LSU secondary to shreds and rode an inspired defensive performance to a 44-34 win over the defending national champions. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss what we now know about the maroon and white and the Air Raid offense.

item.title: 9-21-20: Does An Offseason of Change Benefit Mississippi State or LSU?

item.title: 9-7-20: Who is Mississippi State's Backup Quarterback?

Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss what they learned talking to Coach Leach after practice, including some insight into who is the first man up behind KJ Costello.

item.title: 8-20-20: Can Mississippi State Up The Tempo This Season?
item.description: It seems like every offseason the talk around Mississippi State is a more up-tempo attack on offense, but then it never seems to materialize. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at how this year's squad might finally be the one that puts pressure on the defense.

item.title: 8-10-20: Has College Football Reached the Tipping Point?
item.description: Friday saw the SEC release the extra two opponents, and it appeared we were moving forward with the 2020 season in some form or fashion. 48 hours later, it appears everything has fallen apart and now the season is on the precipice of not happening at all. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss how we got here and is there anyway to salvage this cursed year.

item.title: 7-27-20: Can Mississippi State's Tight Ends Be Productive in the Air Raid Offense?
item.description: It was almost a running joke the past few seasons, as Mississippi State would hype the tight end position in the summer only to ignore them almost all together come fall. This year, in a offense where the tight end position really doesn't exist, how will those players figure in to Mike Leach's plans? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman examine how the Bulldogs can use those players.

item.media:title: T&L Classic: Mississippi State Wins a Crazy Egg Bowl
item.media:description: It was a night the state of Mississippi will never forget, and it set into motion a series of events that reshaped the face of football for both Mississippi State and Ole Miss. Enjoy this Thunder & Lightning replay from late in the postgame day as Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman recap the craziest Egg Bowl ever played.

item.title: 7-20-20: How Different Will Mississippi State's Rushing Offense Be in 2020?
item.description: There has been so much talk and so many projections about how Mississippi State's passing offense will look under Mike Leach, that the running game seems to have been forgotten. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman take a look at what the rushing numbers could look like in season one of the Air Raid.

item.title: T&L Extra: John Cohen Speaks on This Week's Meetings and Football's Future
item.description: John Cohen has been forced, as have athletic directors throughout the country, into a role he never would have expected. How has he handled that, and what are his thoughts as we draw nearer to the scheduled start of football season? Brian Hadad caught up with the Mississippi State athletic director to get his thoughts on that and much more.

item.title: 7-16-20: Is Mississippi State Improved Enough to Beat Auburn?

After a blowout loss on The Plains a season ago, are the Bulldogs in position to turn that game around in 2020? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss that with AL.com Auburn beat writer Tom Green.

item.title: 7-14-20: What Would Have Been Asked of Mississippi State at SEC Media Days?
item.description: Monday should have been the kickoff of the annual SEC Media Days, but instead we can add that gathering to the long list of canceled events due to the coronavirus. But what would the scribes assembled in Atlanta have asked Coach Mike Leach and the Mississippi State contingent? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss what would have been the hot topics at the podium for the Bulldogs.

item.description: It felt like the first move of many on Thursday when the Big 10 announced their teams would be playing a conference only schedule. item.title: T&L Extra: The Athletic's Jon Machota on Dak Prescott's Contract Situation
item.description:
Dak Prescott's contract remains one of the NFL's biggest stories, and the news on Monday that Pat Mahomes had received a massive extension added another layer to the discussion. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman catch up with Jon Machota of The Athletic to get the latest on the favorite Bulldog son and his time as the quarterback of America's team.
Photo courtesy of G.J. McCarthy/The Dallas Morning News

item.title: 7-6-20: Can the Last Pieces From Dan Mullen Lead Mississippi State This Season?
item.description: Dan Mullen's influence on the Mississippi State football program is huge, but for the 2020 season, only seven players are on the roster that actually played for the former Bulldog head coach. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman take a look at the players who represent the final vestiges of Mullen at MSU, and why their success will determine what the Bulldogs are this year.

item.title: 6-29-20: Kylin Hill's Legacy is Intertwined With Mississippi History
item.description: Mississippi saw history this weekend with the legislature making the move to retire the current state flag, and in doing so opening the door to keep NCAA postseason play happening in the state. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman take a look at the new path Mississippi is on, and how whether you want to believe it or not, Kylin Hill played a huge role in forcing this change.

item.title: 6-26-20: Mississippi's Universities Descend Upon the State Capitol
item.description: There will be many words used to describe the summit of coaches who went to the State Capitol on Thursday to plead with legislators in favor of a new flag, but one that fits best is historic. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman were there, and try to relate as best they can what they saw and experienced on this surreal day.

Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman attempt to figure out what to expect on Thanksgiving, with some help from SportsTalk Mississippi's Richard Cross.

item.title: 6-23-20: Could Kylin Hill Sit Out the 2020 Season?
item.description: This offseason has been full of questions about Kylin Hill, and how he will adapt and be effective in the new Air Raid offense Mississippi State plans to unveil. Now, the questions are, will he play at all? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss Hill's very public statement about the Mississippi state flag and his status for the Bulldogs.

item.title: 6-22-20: Mississippi's State Flag Might End Postseason Sports at Home
item.description: Friday saw the NCAA drop a bomb on the state of Mississippi, dictating postseason sporting events would no longer be played in the Magnolia State while the current flag flies. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss that controversial decision, then take a look at men's basketball and what appears to be a tough season looming ahead regardless of Robert Woodard's decision.

item.title: T&L Exclusive: KJ Costello
item.description:
KJ Costello has made it to his new home in Starkville, and now he's just counting the days until he can get back on the field with his Mississippi State teammates. Brian Hadad caught up with State's likely starter to discuss what preparation he has been part of it in this crazy offseason, and what he thinks he can bring to the Air Raid offense.
Photo courtesy of Ron Chenoy/USA Today Sports

item.title: 6-9-20: Mississippi State Lands Immediate Help in Tyrell Shavers
item.description: As discussed on yesterday's Thunder & Lightning, the ball will be in the air early and often for Mississippi State, and that means somebody has to catch it. Could Alabama grad transfer Tyrell Shavers be that man, as he announced on Monday he will be traveling down Highway 82 to play in Starkville this season? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss a good day on the recruiting trail for the Bulldogs.

item.title: T&L Extra: Coach Chris Lemonis Joins SportsTalk Mississippi
item.description:
Last weekend should have been Super Regional time at Dudy Noble Field, but instead, Coach Chris Lemonis was unable to see his team try for an unprecedented third straight trip to Omaha. The Mississippi State skipper joined SportsTalk Mississippi on Monday to discuss what's he been up to this spring, and what Wednesday's MLB Draft will mean for his 2021 squad.
Photo courtesy of Mississippi State athletics

item.title: 6-2-20: Mississippi State Takes The First Steps Back to Football
item.description: It's been a long three months for Mississippi State football, as the program went from hours from the start of spring practice to a shutdown as the coronavirus spread across the country. Now, the Bulldogs are back in Starkville, and the first real steps towards football this fall have been completed. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman take a look at what's happening day one, then begin their SEC Preview series with a look at the defending national champs, with Brody Miller of The Athletic joining the show to break down the LSU Tigers.

item.title: T&L SEC Preview: Brody Miller on the LSU Tigers
item.description:

Photo courtesy of Matt Bush/USA Today

item.title: 5-29-20: Deep Dive: The Start of the Jackie Sherrill Era
item.description: There can be no question that Mississippi State football took its biggest step forward in decades in 1990, when Jackie Sherrill was announced as head coach. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at that event and how it shaped the modern face of Bulldog football, with interviews from former maroon and white legends Bill Sartin and Daniel Boyd.

item.title: 5-25-20: Jarrian Jones and Why The Egg Bowl Rivalry Will Never Cool Off
item.description: One side will call him a hero, the other side will label him a villain, but all Jarrian Jones did by transferring from Mississippi State to Ole Miss is prove a point. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman examine his decision and why it shows any hope for a kinder, gentler Egg Bowl is foolish optimism.

item.title: 5-22-20: Deep Dive: Mississippi State's 1991 SEC Championship
item.description: It had been 28 years since Mississippi State's one and only appearance in the NCAA Men's Basketball Tournament. Not many Bulldog fans would have predicted the 1990-91 team to break that drought, but Coach Richard Williams and his experienced squad fought their way through to earn the program's first SEC title since the 60's. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman welcome Coach Williams and former player Greg Carter to look back at a special season for Bulldog basketball.

item.title: 5-15-20: Deep Dive-The Stansbury Era Part 1
item.description: At a time for Mississippi State where football was at its lowest point, Rick Stansbury gave Bulldog fans something to cheer about and made The Hump one of the most feared places to play in college basketball. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look back at the first half of Stansbury's time in Starkville, and are joined by Bulldog legend Derrick Zimmerman to get his thoughts and relive State's incredible victory over Kentucky in 2002.

item.itunes:summary: Another NFL Draft has seen Mississippi State stars change out maroon and white for a number of new colors, as five Bulldogs heard their name called over the weekend. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at those plus the players on free agent deals, then look to another four matchups in the Greatest Bulldog Bracket.

item.title: 4-24-20: Bulldog Rewind-Jay Hughes Looks Back at MSU-Auburn 2014
item.description: There may never be a grander day in Mississippi State sports than October 11, 2014, as the Bulldogs dominated the #2 ranked Auburn Tigers and vaulted themselves to #1 in the polls for the first time in school history. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman welcome Jay Hughes, starting safety from that year's squad, to relive what might be the biggest win in school history.

item.title: 4-23-20: What Will the NFL Draft Look Like for Mississippi State?
item.description: A year ago was a historic day for Mississippi State, as three Bulldogs hear their name called in the first round of the NFL Draft. There won't be that kind of spotlight on Starkville this year, but several Bulldogs should be heading to the next level. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman take a look at who could make the move up this weekend.

item.title: 4-21-20: Will Keytaon Thompson Be the Only Quarterback Leaving Mississippi State?
item.description: It certainly wasn't unexpected, but finally Keytaon Thompson is making his move away from Mississippi State. The question is, will he be the only the signal caller who enters the portal? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss the quarterback room, who should stay, and who might go.

item.title: Bulldog Rewind: Cole Gordon Relives the 2018 Vanderbilt Super Regional
item.description: There may never have been a better postseason series in college baseball than Mississippi State's incredible win over Vanderbilt in the 2018 Super Regional. Former Bulldog reliever Cole Gordon joins Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman to relive that incredible game three win and the ride that team went on to close the season.

item.title: Deep Dive: Mississippi State's Mercurial 1996 Final Four Run
item.description:
Mississippi State found some magic in March of 1996, unexpectedly putting together one of the greatest runs in Bulldog history together to end up in the Final Four for the first time in school history. Brian Hadad and Brandon Walker look back at an incredible month in maroon.
Photo courtesy of Rich Clarkson/NCAA Photos

item.title: T&L Extra: Dominique Dillingham Looks Back at MSU-UConn 2017
item.description:
There's no question what is the biggest win in the history of Mississippi State women's basketball, the 2017 Final Four victory over Connecticut, which saw the Bulldogs snap the Huskies' incredible 111 game winning streak. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman connect with former Bulldog guard and current assistant coach Dominique Dillingham to relive one of the greatest days in MSU history.
Photo courtesy of Kelly Donoho/Mississippi State athletics

item.title: T&L Extra: Ben Beckwith Recaps Mississippi State-Texas A&M 2014
item.description:
It was the opening act of what many would say was the greatest day in college football history for the state of Mississippi. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman catch up with former All-SEC lineman Ben Beckwith to relive a great day in Bulldog football, State's 48-31 win over Texas A&M.
Photo courtesy of Marvin Gentry-USA TODAY Sports

item.title: 3-31-20: The NCAA Does Right, What's Next For Mississippi State?
item.description: College athletes across the nation got the news they were waiting for on Monday, as the NCAA announced an extra year of eligibility will be provided to all spring sports in wake of mass cancellations due to the coronavirus. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at that from the Mississippi State perspective.

item.title: 3-27-20: Bulldog Rewind-March Madness Mississippi State Style
item.description: Mississippi State enjoyed a fantastic March run in 1996, culminating with the school's only trip to the Final Four. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman welcome two Bulldog legends, Coach Richard Williams and "Super D" Darryl Wilson to the show to discuss two of the biggest wins in MSU history from that magical month 24 years ago.

item.title: T&L Extra: Coach Zach Arnett on the New Look Mississippi State Defense
item.description:
Mississippi State should have been wrapping up week one of spring practice, but instead the new coaching staff is talking to players via FaceTime and text messaging to keep them prepared for the coming season. Brian Hadad caught up with new MSU defensive coordinator Zach Arnett to get a look at what the Bulldogs are planning for when Mike Leach's Air Raid offense is on the sidelines.
Photo courtesy of Kelly Donoho/Mississippi State athletics

item.title: Deep Dive: Mississippi State's 2014 Football Season
item.description:
Mississippi State took the college football world by storm in 2014, rising to number one in the polls for the first time in school history for a five week span that no Bulldog fan will ever forget. Brian Hadad welcomes Brandon Walker of Barstool Sports as the pair discuss that season in the first of this series of deep dives into the great moments in Bulldog athletics.
Photo courtesy of Wesley Hitt/Getty Images

item.title: 3-24-20: How Does Mississippi State Market Through Uncertainty?
item.description: Mississippi State had a ton of momentum after the hiring of Mike Leach, looking like they could be expecting record sales with the incredible excitement surrounding the program. How does the Bulldog marketing staff keep that energy through these weeks of uncertainty? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman catch up with MSU marketing guru Leah Beasley to ask what she and her staff can do in these tough times.

item.title: 3-12-20: Mississippi State Halts Everything as Coronavirus Stops the Sports World
item.description: 24 hours ago, Mississippi State was getting ready for a big weekend in sports with the basketball team fighting for an NCAA Tournament bid and baseball opening SEC play. Instead, the Bulldogs and every other team around the country will sit at home as fears of the coronavirus have brought the sports world to a standstill. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss what's going on as uncertainty is the only thing that is certain for now.

item.title: 1-31-20: Examining Expectations for Mississippi State Basketball
item.description: There's no question this has been an up and down season for Mississippi State men's basketball, and that the team has underachieved at times. But are some Bulldog fans holding this team and Coach Ben Howland to an impossible standard? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at some recent social media statements from the maroon and white faithful that seem to be asking for too much from the program.

item.title: T&L Extra: Jake Mangum Joins SportsTalk Mississippi
item.description:
Perhaps the biggest difference for Mississippi State baseball this season will come in the bottom of the first, when the familiar strains of The Outfield's "Your Love" won't play out to signal Jake Mangum coming to the plate. The SEC hit king joined SportsTalk Mississippi on Thursday to discuss how different this January is for him and what's coming soon for him in spring training with the New York Mets.
Photo courtesy of Mississippi State athletics

item.title: 1-13-20: Has Mississippi State Changed The Expectation Level?
item.description: In a span of seven days, Mississippi State fired a coach who had taken them to back to back bowl games and hired a sitting power five head coach who has been to 16 bowls in 18 years. Did the expectation level in Starkville just go to a new level? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman take a look at a new day for the Bulldogs.

item.title: 1-4-2020: T&L Emergency Edition: Joe Moorhead Fired at Mississippi State

Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at what the offseason will bring to the Bulldogs, and how they can go about getting their problems solved.

item.title: 12-31-19: Mississippi State's Frustrating Season Comes to An End
item.description: Mississippi State will not look back fondly on the 2019 season, and looking ahead to 2020 might not be the happiest idea either. Brian Hadad looks at a program that is at a crossroads, and asks which turn will bring the Bulldogs back to winning ways.

item.title: 12-23-19: Should Fans Be Worried About Mississippi State Basketball?
item.description: It was supposed to be a triumphant return to the court for Nick Weatherspoon in his hometown, but instead, the junior guard fouled out and his Mississippi State team fell for the third time this season in a 58-52 decision to New Mexico State. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman ask if Bulldog fans should be concerned about this team.

item.title: 12-17-19: Mississippi State's Offensive Leaders Are Ready for Louisville
item.description: Mississippi State has seen the tape of Louisville, and the Bulldogs have to be thinking their ground game can be very effective against the Cardinals. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss what Garrett Shrader and Kylin Hill had to say, plus an early look at the Diamond Dawgs and their ranking in the first preseason poll of the year.

item.title: 12-16-19: Who Will Use Mississippi State's Bowl as a Launching Point?
item.description: Dak Prescott's dominant performance in the 2013 Liberty Bowl set the stage for him becoming the SEC's best quarterback in 2014. Can a Mississippi State underclassmen make a similar statement in this year's Music City Bowl. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss that and the men's basketball team's gritty comeback win over Kansas State.

item.title: 12-13-19: What Is The Legacy of Kylin Hill?
item.description: Mississippi State got the news it was dreading on Thursday, as all-SEC tailback Kylin Hill announced he would forgo his senior year to enter the NFL Draft. What is the legacy of this immensely talented player, and what does it for the Bulldog offense in 2020? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman break down what Hill's departure will mean.

item.title: 12-3-19: What Does Matt Luke's Dismissal At Ole Miss Mean For Mississippi State?
item.description: One thing that's been said many times on this podcast is what ever happens at Mississippi State affects Ole Miss, and vice versa. So with the surprise firing of Matt Luke in Oxford, what will the repercussions be in Starkville? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman try to answer that question, plus make their best guess where the Bulldogs will go bowling.

item.title: 12-2-19: Why Joe Moorhead Was Always Coming Back to Mississippi State
item.description: There was enough smoke to run a barbeque restaurant surrounding Mississippi State and the future of Coach Joe Moorhead last week, but in the end, the Bulldogs will remain under Moorhead's tutelage for the 2020 season. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman explain that despite the deluge of rumors, this was the likely move the entire time.

item.title: T&L Extra: Ben Garrett of the Ole Miss Spirit Talks Rebel Offense vs. MSU Defense
item.description:
Ole Miss has reinvented itself on offense this season, going from a high powered passing game to a bruising rushing attack with freshman John Rhys Plumlee at the controls. Brian Hadad catches up with Ben Garrett of the Ole Miss Spirit to get a look at how the Rebels will try to attack Mississippi State's defense, finally at full strength.
Photo courtesy of Mississippi State athletics

item.title: T&L Exclusive: Coach Chris Lemonis Wraps Up Recruiting and Looks Ahead to 2020
item.description: It may be a few months before first pitch at Dudy Noble Field, but many Mississippi State fans can hardly wait for Coach Chris Lemonis' encore after a run back to the College World Series in his first year. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman catch with the Diamond Dawg skipper to get his thoughts on the upcoming season and his highly touted recruiting class.

item.title: 11-21-19: Where Does Mississippi State Have the Advantage Over Ole Miss?
item.description: In 2016, Nick Fitzgerald and Mississippi State ran over, around, and through Ole Miss en route to a blowout win in the Battle For the Golden Egg. This season, could it be Ole Miss who takes back the trophy behind possibly the best running quarterback in the SEC? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman make the comparisons between those two games and looks to find where the Bulldogs have the upper hand against the Rebels.

item.title: 11-19-19: Why Are Mississippi State Fans Conceding The Egg Bowl?
item.description: Mississippi State will face Ole Miss in just over a week's time, with a likely bowl bid on the line for the Bulldogs. It hasn't been a great season for either side, but so many of the maroon and white faithful are already preparing for the worst. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman want to know why so many believe the Rebels will walk out of Starkville with the Golden Egg.

item.title: 11-4-19: What's True After Mississippi State Hammers Arkansas?
item.description: Mississippi State had one objective as it traveled to Arkansas on Saturday, and it was to get a win. The Bulldogs did much more than that, embarrassing the Razorbacks behind the surprise return of Tommy Stevens and the dominant rushing of Kylin Hill. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss what we have learned after that blowout win.

item.media:description: Mississippi State has won three in a row against Texas A&M, and the reason behind that winning streak is simple, the Bulldogs have been the more physical team. Is that still the case? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman look at the line of scrimmage, with a peek at the Aggies from Alex Miller of the Dallas Morning News.

item.title: 10-22-19: Will Mississippi State Fans Accept Joe Moorhead's Message?
item.description: Joe Moorhead's last few moments behind the microphone have had a common theme, that he is building a program better than the one he inherited when he took the job two Novembers ago. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman ask, is this the message Mississippi State fans want to hear, and will they buy in to what Moorhead is selling?

item.title: 10-8-19: What Do Joe Moorhead and Nick Fitzgerald Have in Common?
item.description: There's an old saying that goes, never be the guy who follows the guy. For Mississippi State head Joe Moorhead, that must feel like words of wisdom as criticism continues to pile on to him. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman explain why he and former Bulldog quarterback Nick Fitzgerald have that problem in common, and how Moorhead can disarm his critics.

item.title: 9-24-19: How Will Joe Moorhead Manage His Quarterback Situation?
item.description: They say when you have two quarterbacks, you don't have one. That's the dilemma facing Joe Moorhead in the coming weeks, as both Tommy Stevens and Garrett Shrader have made their statements to be Mississippi State's quarterback for the 2019 season. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman analyze Coach Moorhead's comments from Monday's press conference and give their thoughts on how they'd manage this tricky situation.

item.media:title: 7-30-19: Mississippi State's Front Seven Showcase Two Different Sets of Questions
item.media:description: Mississippi State's defensive line lost more experience and talent than any other group on the team. Mississippi State's linebacking corps might be the best in the SEC. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman examine how these two units will work together this season.

item.title: 7-29-19: Has Mississippi State Gained More Respect Nationally?
item.description: Inside the Mississippi State bubble, 2018 was a disappointing season stunted by Joe Moorhead's offense not reaching anywhere near it's preseason potential. So why then have so many national voices started giving more respect to the Bulldogs this offsesason? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman are back from vacation with a look at what's changed about the program's perception.

item.title: 7-19-19: Mississippi State Will Look to Repair Year Old Wounds Against Kentucky
item.description: A year ago, Mississippi State traveled to Kentucky confident of victory, only to get smacked in the mouth in a humbling defeat. Brian Hadad looks ahead to the rematch in Starkville, and how the Bulldogs can get back the mojo they left on the field in Lexington.

item.title: 7-18-19: Joe Moorhead Talks Expectations and Honesty at SEC Media Days
item.description:
Normally SEC Media Days is nothing but a whole lot of coachspeak and cliches, but when Joe Moorhead took the podium on Wednesday, he spoke about topics that were a little off the beaten path. Brian Hadad discusses that and why what Moorhead said was words the true maroon faithful should take in stride.
Photo courtesy of Mississippi State athletics

Brian Hadad weighs in on that, plus the Opponent Preview Series continues with a look at the LSU Tigers courtesy of ESPN Radio's Matt Moscona.

Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman break that position down, plus preview Texas A&M with GigEm247's Jeff Tarpley.

Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman take a look at who would be on the Bulldogs' wish list.

Can the Penn State transfer make himself welcome in the locker room, and win over the fans who have decided to align themselves with Keytaon Thompson? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss that, plus continue the Opponent Preview series with Arkansas and HawgBeat.com's Andrew Hutchinson.

item.title: 6-26-19: Can Charles Cross Live Up to Five Star Expectations as a Freshman?
item.description: One of Joe Moorhead's biggest wins in the 2019 recruiting cycle was landing one of the nation's best offensive line prospects in Laurel, MS tackle Charles Cross. But with a five star ranking come big expectations, is Cross ready to live up to that hype in year one? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman debate that, plus a look at the non-committal answers surrounding Nick Weatherspoon's future at MSU, plus the Opponent Preview series continues with Alabama and AL.com's Michael Casagrande.

item.title: 6-24-19: What Was Mississippi State Baseball's Defining Moment?
item.description: With the pain of Thursday's season ending loss beginning to fade, the time for introspection into this Mississippi State baseball season has come. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman discuss the moments they'll remember from this past year, and take a quick look into next season and the future of Bulldog baseball with Chris Lemonis.

item.title: 6-21-19: Saying Goodbye to the 2019 Mississippi State Baseball Team
item.description: It was a season to remember and a loss to forget, as Mississippi State's Omaha odyssey ends in heartbreak following a 4-3 loss to Louisville in Thursday's elimination game. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman open up about their thoughts of this team, the players, and why saying goodbye hurts so much.

item.title: 6-20-19: Detailing Mississippi State's Difficult Task To Advance in the College World Series
item.description: Mississippi State finds itself where it did not want to be, in the loser's bracket and facing the possibility of elimination with another defeat. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman examine the arduous climb the Bulldogs face if they want to continue in the College World Series.

item.title: 6-19-19: How Does the CWS Schedule Change Affect Mississippi State?
item.description: Mother Nature decided she had seen enough baseball in Omaha on Tuesday, moving Mississippi State's winner's bracket game against Vanderbilt to Wednesday afternoon. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman examine how that shift changes everything going forward for the Bulldogs win or lose.

item.title: 6-18-19: Preview, Playmakers, and Predictions for Mississippi State-Vanderbilt
item.description: It almost feels like a de facto national championship game, even though the winner still has more to do. Mississippi State and Vanderbilt will battle to take control of their bracket at the College World Series, Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman have the breakdown.

item.title: 6-17-19: Mississippi State's Win Over Auburn Defies Description
item.description: Mississippi State was all but penciled into the loser's bracket with three outs to go on Sunday night, but an unbelievable comeback has the Bulldogs locked into a showdown with Vanderbilt to take control of the College World Series. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman try to put into words what happened at TD Ameritrade Park.

Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman have that list, plus the beginning of the football Opponent Preview series with Brian Scott Rippee joining the show to look ahead to the Egg Bowl.

item.title: T&L Opponent Preview: Brian Scott Rippee Takes a Look at Ole Miss
item.description:
It's only 12 weeks until football season begins, so that means it is time for Thunder & Lightning to kick off their annual opponent preview, and in keeping with tradition, we begin with the end and a look at the Egg Bowl. SportsTalk Mississippi's Brian Scott Rippee takes a look at what should be an interesting year for a young Ole Miss team.
Photo courtesy of Kelly Donoho/Mississippi State athletics

item.title: 6-12-19: Is It National Title or Bust for Mississippi State?
item.description: Mississippi State did one of the most difficult things to do in sports, the Bulldogs met high expectations. But is that enough to call this season a success? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman asks if a national title is the only finish to the season that wouldn't be considered a failure.

item.title: 6-10-19: Mississippi State Returns to the College World Series
item.description: Mississippi State has been a juggernaut all season long, and months of work culminated Sunday night as the Bulldogs punched their ticket for a return trip to Omaha and the College World Series. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman take a look at the emotion of State's 8-1 win over Stanford.

item.title: 6-6-19: Will JT Ginn Pitch for Mississippi State This Weekend?
item.description: It has been a real grind for true freshman star JT Ginn in the second half of the season, and now Coach Chris Lemonis says Mississippi State's young star hasn't even thrown this week after leaving last Friday's game with soreness. Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman ask if the Bulldogs can rely on Ginn this weekend, and what's the plan if he can't go.

item.title: T&L Extra: Coach Jake Gautreau Joins SportsTalk Mississippi
item.description:
Mississippi State's hitters have been among the nation's best all season long. Bulldog assistant coach Jake Gautreau joined SportsTalk Mississippi on Tuesday to discuss what he's been doing with the Diamond Dawg hitters, and more importantly, what he hasn't done.
Photo courtesy of Mississippi State athletics

item.title: 5-30-19: Has Mississippi State Prepared for the Pressure of the Postseason?
item.description: When look back at Mississippi State's season, you see a team that was basically on cruise control. Did the Bulldogs ever really face the kind of adversity to build you for a postseason run, or will they have to rely on the lessons of last year? Brian Hadad and Joel Coleman take a look at how this team will react to the pressure.

item.title: T&L Extra: Previewing Central Michigan With CM Life's Austin Chastain
item.description:
Central Michigan comes to Starkville as one of the nation's hottest teams. Brian Hadad caught up with Austin Chastain, who covers the Chippewas for Central Michigan Life, the student newspaper in Mount Pleasant, to get a preview of the MAC Champions.
Photo courtesy of Issac Ritchey
